SEARCH
Package io.codefine.onequery.impl

Class OneQuery<R extends org.jooq.Record>

java.lang.Object
io.codefine.onequery.impl.OneQuery<R>
All Implemented Interfaces:
OneQueryCollectStep<R>, OneQueryFetchStep<R>, OneQueryFilterStep<R>, OneQueryFromStep<R>, OneQueryOnStep<R>, OneQueryOptionalPaginationStep<R>, OneQueryPaginationResultStep<R>, OneQueryPaginationStep<R>, OneQuerySortStep<R>
public final class OneQuery<R extends org.jooq.Record> extends Object implements OneQueryOnStep<R>, OneQueryFromStep<R>, OneQueryFilterStep<R>, OneQuerySortStep<R>, OneQueryOptionalPaginationStep<R>, OneQueryPaginationStep<R>, OneQueryCollectStep<R>, OneQueryFetchStep<R>, OneQueryPaginationResultStep<R>
A class that provides configuration on top of JOOQ to help filter, sort and paginate, the main purpose of the API is pagination as the API will reassemble your query and count the total number of items, but it also provides handy conversion methods for sorting and filtering that you can use without pagination.

The implementation of the class is strictly tied to the resulting jooq interface type, if an invalid interface is passed an auxiliary interface will be returned to help `refine` the query to a valid one and call the .filter(), .sort() and .paginate() methods.

There are some interfaces that are not supported, for example: SelectFromStep which will be returned when .select().into() is called, calling .query() with such interfaces will cause NotImplementedException (possible fix in future versions), there is an example jooq builder for each of the interfaces.

    Takes page, size, returns OneQueryPaginationResultStep, the total number of elements is calculated "under the hood" using the .selectCount(), offset using .offset(), and limit number .limit().

  • Method Details

    • query

      @Deprecated(since="0.0.1", forRemoval=true) public static <T extends org.jooq.Record> OneQueryFilterStep<T> query(org.jooq.SelectFinalStep<T> query)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      since version 0.0.1
      Accepts a common interface for all requests SelectFinalStep, this method is not stable and needs improvement, unforeseen errors are possible.

      Example jooq builder: 

      
     create.select()
         .from()
         .join()
         .on()
         .where()
         .and()
         .groupBy()
         .having()
         .orderBy()
         .limit()
         .offset()
         .forUpdate()
         .of()
         .noWait();

      Not recommended for use.

    • query

      public static <T extends org.jooq.Record> OneQueryFilterStep<T> query(org.jooq.SelectConnectByStep<T> query)
      Accepts SelectConnectByStep and returns OneQueryPaginationStep

      Example jooq builder: 

      
     create.select()
         .from()
         .join(TableLike)
         .on()
         .where()
         .and()

    • paginate

      public OneQueryPaginationResultStep<R> paginate(Page page)
      Description copied from interface: OneQueryPaginationStep
      The method takes Page and returns OneQueryPaginationResultStep. The total number of elements is calculated "under the hood" using the .selectCount(), sort, offset using .offset(), and limit number .limit().

      Page numbering must start with 0.

      Specified by:
      paginate in interface OneQueryPaginationStep<R extends org.jooq.Record>

    • paginate

      public OneQueryPaginationResultStep<R> paginate(int page, int size)
      Description copied from interface: OneQueryPaginationStep
      Takes page, size, returns OneQueryPaginationResultStep, the total number of elements is calculated "under the hood" using the .selectCount(), offset using .offset(), and limit number .limit().

      Page numbering must start with 0.

      Specified by:
      paginate in interface OneQueryPaginationStep<R extends org.jooq.Record>

    • toPaginationResult

      public <C> PaginationResult<C> toPaginationResult(Class<C> clazz)
      Description copied from interface: OneQueryPaginationResultStep
      The method takes a class to which all objects in the response must be cast. If you need to welcome an entity to the generated jooq class, you need to use the classes from the pojos package.
      Specified by:
      toPaginationResult in interface OneQueryPaginationResultStep<R extends org.jooq.Record>

    • toPaginationResult

      public <C> PaginationResult<C> toPaginationResult(org.jooq.RecordMapper<R,C> mapper)
      Description copied from interface: OneQueryPaginationResultStep
      The method accepts an entity mapper with Record as a parameter.

      Example mapper: 

      
     record2 -> {
        String[] array = new String[2];
        array[0] = record2.value1();
        array[1] = record2.value2();
        return array;
     }
      Specified by:
      toPaginationResult in interface OneQueryPaginationResultStep<R extends org.jooq.Record>

    • fetch

      public org.jooq.Result<R> fetch() throws org.jooq.exception.DataAccessException
      Description copied from interface: OneQueryFetchStep
      The method is a copy of the .fetch() method from the ResultQuery interface in Jooq
      Specified by:
      fetch in interface OneQueryFetchStep<R extends org.jooq.Record>
      Returns:
      The result. This will never be null.
      Throws:
      org.jooq.exception.DataAccessException - if something went wrong executing the query.
      See Also:
      • ResultQuery.fetch()
